channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Homicides keep plunging in Trump's "hellhole" cities
item.description: Homicide rates continued to decline in major U.S. cities — by more than 40% in some communities — during the first nine months of the year, according ...

item.title: MLB's 2025 ratings resurgence
item.description: Data: Axios research, Nielsen; Note: Viewership numbers for Game 7 of the 2025 World Series are preliminary; Chart: Axios Visuals At least 25 million ...

item.title: Behind the Curtain: Inside post-Kirk MAGA's reality
item.description: Many feared the assassination of Charlie Kirk would tear apart the country. Instead, it's ripping apart some of MAGA's biggest celebrities. Why it mat...

item.title: Chaos at the FDA leaves staffers disturbed, ready to leave
item.description: The weekend's chaos at the Food and Drug Administration is prompting questions around how much more the agency can take before its functionality is se...

item.title: Former Vice President Dick Cheney dies at 84
item.description: Former Vice President Dick Cheney, 84, died Monday from complications of pneumonia and cardiac and vascular disease, his family announced and multiple...

item.title: Trump’s foe in tariffs case? A legal group funded by conservatives.
item.description: The Supreme Court test of Trump’s tariffs is backed by a legal group funded without disclosure by some of the wealthiest conservative donors.

item.title: The first-term Democrat facing a Trump prosecution
item.description: “I don’t want to be in jail.” Rep. LaMonica McIver is fighting Trump in court — and risks 17 years behind bars.

item.title: NRA furloughs staff as it prepares to rebuild ahead of 2026
item.description: The once-mighty gun rights group is trying to balance its books after years of misspending.

item.title: Five big questions for Trump and Democrats on Election Day 2025
item.description: For the president, the party out of power and more, there is a lot at stake at the ballot box in Virginia, New Jersey, New York and California.

item.title: Senators look to Election Day to help break shutdown impasse
item.description: Lawmakers believe Tuesday’s elections will encourage senators in both parties to find a way to reopen the government.

item.title: Reaganomics in Jersey: Jack Ciattarelli has a supply-side dream if he’s elected governor this week
item.description: The Republican nominee has promised tax cuts and economic growth, but the numbers are fuzzy.

item.title: Trump's approval holds steady despite unpopular policies, per new NYT poll
item.description: Trump’s strength with Republicans on the economy could prove to be a boon for the GOP.

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
